        public static final java.lang.String contextRegex
        Every timeline filename contains the "context" aka the named graph in the triplestore So a valid timeline filename must begin with this pattern expressed as a regex :

    • Method Detail

      • isValidContextFileFormat

        public static boolean isValidContextFileFormat(java.io.File file)
        Check if a timeline filename is valid. It must end according to the DefaultRDFformat and begin by contextRegex
        Parameters:
        file - A timeline file
        Returns:
        true if the fileName is a valid timeline file

      • isValidContextName

        public static boolean isValidContextName(java.lang.String contextName)
        Check if contextName is valid according to contextRegex
        Parameters:
        contextName - A string of local context name
        Returns:
        true if the context name is valid

      • getContextIRI

        public static org.eclipse.rdf4j.model.IRI getContextIRI(java.io.File file)
                                                 throws InvalidContextFormatException
        Parameters:
        file - A timeline file
        Returns:
        the contextIRI (named graph IRI)
        Throws:
        InvalidContextFormatException - If the filename is incorrect according to isValidContextFileFormat}

      • getIRI

        public static org.eclipse.rdf4j.model.IRI getIRI(java.lang.String localName)
        Add the namespace of the ontology used EIG to a String
        Parameters:
        localName - The name of a resource (event, predicate, values) in my ontology
        Returns:
        an IRI in the namespace of my ontology

      • getContextIRI

        public static org.eclipse.rdf4j.model.IRI getContextIRI(java.lang.String contextName)
                                                 throws InvalidContextException
        Check if the context String is correct and return the IRI of the context (named graph)
        Parameters:
        contextName - A string of the context localName (ex : p20)
        Returns:
        an IRI of the contextName in the namespace of my ontology
        Throws:
        InvalidContextException - if contextName is not valid

      • makeLiteral

        public static org.eclipse.rdf4j.model.Literal makeLiteral(org.eclipse.rdf4j.model.IRI datatypeUri,
                                                          java.lang.String literal)
                                                   throws org.eclipse.rdf4j.model.util.LiteralUtilException,
                                                          java.text.ParseException
        Given the datatypeUri and a literal string (numeric, date...) return a well formatted Literal for RDF statement
        Parameters:
        datatypeUri - Must be a primitive or derived datatype. See XMLDatatypeUtil.isBuiltInDatatype(org.eclipse.rdf4j.model.IRI)}
        literal - A value expected for this datatypeUri
        Returns:
        A literal well formatted
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - If error during Literal construction
        org.eclipse.rdf4j.model.util.LiteralUtilException

      • parseDate

        public static java.util.Date parseDate(java.lang.String dateString)
                                throws java.text.ParseException
        Authorized dateString format are the following :
        • YYYY_MM_DD
        • YYYY_MM_DD_HH
        • YYYY_MM_DD_HH_MM
        • YYYY_MM_DD_HH_MM_SS
        This function returns a date or throws a ParseException
        Parameters:
        dateString - The string of a date
        Returns:
        a Date
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - If format is incorrect or date invalid

      • dateStringToLiteral

        public static org.eclipse.rdf4j.model.Literal dateStringToLiteral(java.lang.String dateString)
                                                           throws java.text.ParseException
        Transform dateString to date parseDate then date to Literal
        Parameters:
        dateString - The string of a date
        Returns:
        a date Literal
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - If format is incorrect or date invalid
